commitMessage:
feat: show decision questions in /explore preview instead of count (HODGE-323)

## What Changed

**Template Enhancement** (1 file, +8 lines):
- .claude/commands/explore.md: Updated Phase 3 preview format
  - Changed "Decisions Needed: [count]" to numbered list format
  - Added bold "**No Decisions Needed**" for zero-decision case
  - Preserves all other preview sections unchanged

**Test Coverage** (1 file, +40 lines):
- src/lib/claude-commands.smoke.test.ts: Added 4 smoke tests
  - Validates numbered decision list format (1, 2, 3...)
  - Validates bold "No Decisions Needed" format
  - Validates preview structure preservation
  - Validates approval options presence

**Auto-sync** (1 file, +8 lines):
- src/lib/claude-commands.ts: Synchronized template changes

**Metadata Updates** (6 files):
- .hodge/: Session state, context, and project tracking synchronized

## Why This Change

The /explore command's Phase 3 approval preview previously showed only a count of decisions (e.g., "3 decisions for /decide phase"), which didn't give users visibility into what those decisions actually were before approving the exploration. This created an incomplete approval workflow - users couldn't make informed decisions about whether to approve, revise, or request changes without seeing the actual decision questions.

This implements a template-only enhancement following the proven pattern from HODGE-306 and HODGE-319.3 (template-based AI orchestration).

## Impact

✅ **UX Improvement**: Users now see actual decision questions in preview, enabling informed approval decisions
✅ **Zero Risk**: Template-only change with no CLI code modifications
✅ **Well-tested**: 4 smoke tests + 738 total tests passing
✅ **Backward Compatible**: Existing /explore flows unchanged, pure enhancement
✅ **Pattern Consistency**: Follows established template enhancement approach

Closes HODGE-323
